discussion.content:
R2(config)#interface fastEthernet 0/0
R2(config-if)#ip ospf message-digest-key 1 md5 MYPASS
R2(config-if)#ip ospf authentication message-digest

For MD5 authentication you need different commands. First use ip ospf message-digest-key X md5 to specify the key number and a password. It doesnâ€™t matter which key number you choose but it has to be the same on both ends. To enable OSPF authentication you need to type in ip ospf authentication message-digest.

questions.question_text: Which command do you enter to enable authentication for OSPF on an interface?
Which two functions can SIEM provide? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: I think B and D are correct.

choices.E: event aggregation that allows for reduced log storage requirements
choices.B: proactive malware analysis to block malicious traffic
choices.D: correlation between logs and events from multiple systems

Symbol Description
* Time is not authoritative.
blank Time is authoritative.
. Time is authoritative, but NTP is not synchronized.

choices.A: The time is authoritative, but the NTP process has lost contact with its servers.
choices.B: The time is authoritative because the clock is in sync.
choices.C: The clock is out of sync.

choices.B: The switch will cycle through the configured authentication methods indefinitely.
choices.C: The authentication attempt will time out and the switch will place the port into the unauthorized state.
choices.D: The authentication attempt will time out and the switch will place the port into VLAN 101.
choices.A: The supplicant will fail to advance beyond the webauth method.

questions.answer_description: Incorrect credentials supplied will result in failure to advance beyond webauth method. The authentication needs correct credentials as seen in the exhibit.

TACACS+ uses Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) port 49 to communicate between the TACACS+ client and the TACACS+ server. An example is a Cisco switch authenticating and authorizing administrative access to the switchs IOS CLI. The switch is the TACACS+ client, and Cisco Secure ACS is the server.
TACACS+ communication between the client and server uses different message types depending on the function. In other words, different messages may be used for authentication than are used for authorization and accounting. Another very interesting point to know is that TACACS+ communication will encrypt the entire packet.
Reference: http://www.networkworld.com/article/2838882/radius-versus-tacacs.html
questions.question_text: In which three ways does the TACACS protocol differ from RADIUS? (Choose three.)

choices.A: TACACS uses TCP to communicate with the NAS.
choices.F: TACACS encrypts only the password field in an authentication packet.
choices.B: TACACS can encrypt the entire packet that is sent to the NAS.
choices.E: TACACS uses UDP to communicate with the NAS.
choices.D: TACACS authenticates and authorizes simultaneously, causing fewer packets to be transmitted.
